00001 /*
00002  * EbmTester.h
00003  *
00004  *  Created on: Sep 26, 2008
00005  *      Author: koray
00006  */
00007 
00008 #ifndef EBMTESTER_H_
00009 #define EBMTESTER_H_
00010 
00011 #include "Ebm.h"
00012 #include <stdio.h>
00013 #include <iostream>
00014 #include <sstream>
00015 #include <ostream>
00016 
00017 using namespace ebl;
00018 
00019 /*
00020  * Tests any module that is descendant of module_1_1. (includes layers_n)
00021  * bprop to input and to parameters are validated with finite difference
00022  * approximations.
00023  *
00024  * This class is not meant to replace the testing framework for eblearn developers
00025  * but it should be useful for eblearn users that create new modules using this
00026  * library as a binary reference
00027  */
00028 class ModuleTester {
00029 public:
00030 
00031         /*
00032          * Standard constructor
00033          */
00034     ModuleTester();
00035     /*
00036      * out    : reference to ostream to push results
00037      * thres  : threshold to decide bprop and finite diff jacobian are same or different
00038      *          this might be tricky because if the modules accumulates derivatives, then the
00039      *          difference will inevitably grow, so use has to have a sense of what is valid
00040      *          default : 1e-8
00041      * rrange : range that is used to randomize the input state and parameter objects.
00042      *          if this value is very small, then the jacobians will always be very similar
00043      */
00044     ModuleTester(FILE* out, double thres, double rrange);
00045     /*
00046      * thres  : threshold to decide bprop and finite diff jacobian are same or different
00047      *          this might be tricky because if the modules accumulates derivatives, then the
00048      *          difference will inevitably grow, so use has to have a sense of what is valid
00049      *          default : 1e-8
00050      * rrange : range that is used to randomize the input state and parameter objects.
00051      *          if this value is very small, then the jacobians will always be very similar
00052      */
00053     ModuleTester(double thres, double rrange);
00054 
00055     virtual ~ModuleTester();
00056 
00057     /*
00058      * test the derivative of output wrt input
00059      * module : pointer to a module_1_1
00060      * in     : pointer to state_idx
00061      * out    : pointer to state_idx
00062      */
00063     void test_jacobian(module_1_1<state_idx,state_idx> *module, state_idx *in, state_idx *out);
00064     /*
00065      * test the derivative of output wrt parameters of the module
00066      * p      : pointer to parameter object that was used to allocate the parameters of module.
00067      *          this parameter object should contain the parameter of only this module
00068      * module : pointer to a module_1_1
00069      * in     : pointer to state_idx
00070      * out    : pointer to state_idx
00071      */
00072     void test_jacobian_param(parameter *p, module_1_1<state_idx,state_idx>* module, state_idx *in, state_idx *out);
00073 
00074     /*
00075      * get accuracy threshold
00076      */
00077     double get_acc_thres() const;
00078     /*
00079      * set accuracy threshold
00080      */
00081     void set_acc_thres(double acc_thres);
00082     /*
00083      * get random range
00084      */
00085     double get_rrange() const;
00086     /*
00087      * set random range
00088      */
00089     void set_rrange(double rrange);
00090     /*
00091      * get ostream used
00092      */
00093     FILE* get_out() const;
00094     /*
00095      * set ostream
00096      */
00097     void set_out(FILE* out);
00098 
00099 private:
00100         // accuracy threshold
00101     double acc_thres;
00102     // ranfom initialization range
00103     double rrange;
00104     // output stream
00105     FILE* out;
00106     // jacobian from fprop
00107     Idx<double> jac_fprop;
00108     // jacobian from bprop;
00109     Idx<double> jac_bprop;
00110     // jacobian from fprop wrt param
00111     Idx<double> jac_fprop_param;
00112     // jacobian from bprop wrt param
00113     Idx<double> jac_bprop_param;
00114 
00115     Idx<double>* kk;
00116 
00117     /*
00118      * get jacobian using 1st order central finite differnce approximation for derivative of output wrt input
00119      * module : pointer to a module_1_1
00120      * in     : pointer to state_idx
00121      * out    : pointer to state_idx
00122      */
00123     void get_jacobian_fprop(module_1_1<state_idx,state_idx> *module, state_idx *in, state_idx *out,Idx<double>& jac);
00124     /*
00125      * get jacobian using 1st order central finite differnce approximation for derivative of output wrt parameter
00126      * p      : pointer to parameter object that was used to allocate the parameters of module.
00127      *          this parameter object should contain the parameter of only this module
00128      * module : pointer to a module_1_1
00129      * in     : pointer to state_idx
00130      * out    : pointer to state_idx
00131      */
00132     void get_jacobian_fprop_param(parameter *p, module_1_1<state_idx,state_idx> *module, state_idx *in, state_idx *out,Idx<double>& jac);
00133     /*
00134      * get jacobian using bprop for derivative of output wrt input
00135      * module : pointer to a module_1_1
00136      * in     : pointer to state_idx
00137      * out    : pointer to state_idx
00138      */
00139     void get_jacobian_bprop(module_1_1<state_idx,state_idx> *module, state_idx *in, state_idx *out,Idx<double>& jac);
00140     /*
00141      * get jacobian using bprop for derivative of output wrt parameter
00142      * p      : pointer to parameter object that was used to allocate the parameters of module.
00143      *          this parameter object should contain the parameter of only this module
00144      * module : pointer to a module_1_1
00145      * in     : pointer to state_idx
00146      * out    : pointer to state_idx
00147      */
00148     void get_jacobian_bprop_param(parameter *p, module_1_1<state_idx,state_idx> *module, state_idx *in, state_idx *out,Idx<double>& jac);
00149     /*
00150      * a : first Idx to compare
00151      * b : second Idx to compare
00152      * c : message to use
00153      */
00154     void report_err(Idx<double>& a, Idx<double>& b, const char* msg);
00155     /*
00156      * assigns random numbers to every element of give idx
00157      */
00158     void randomize_idx(Idx<double>& m);
00159 };
00160 
00161 #endif /* EBMTESTER_H_ */
